body_html:
@gunan We were handling this in the docker build process by our own. We may not turn to the non-ssl one and we'd like to wait for next update building from tensorflow. And @yifeif , you will rebuild all the old images(such as 1.7-gpu-py3 etc.) using the updated base image, right？

UPDATE
@gunan I've just tested building without https, the problem seems still there:

Err:11 http://developer.download.nvidia.com/compute/cuda/repos/ubuntu1604/x86_64  Release.gpg
  The following signatures were invalid: NODATA 1  NODATA 2
Err:12 http://developer.download.nvidia.com/compute/machine-learning/repos/ubuntu1604/x86_64  Release.gpg
  The following signatures were invalid: NODATA 1  NODATA 2
Get:13 http://security.ubuntu.com/ubuntu xenial-security/restricted amd64 Packages [12.7 kB]
Get:14 http://security.ubuntu.com/ubuntu xenial-security/universe amd64 Packages [450 kB]
Get:15 http://security.ubuntu.com/ubuntu xenial-security/multiverse amd64 Packages [3735 B]
Get:16 http://cn.archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu xenial/restricted amd64 Packages [14.1 kB]
Get:17 http://cn.archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu xenial/universe amd64 Packages [9827 kB]
Get:18 http://cn.archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu xenial/multiverse amd64 Packages [176 kB]

Get:23 http://cn.archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu xenial-backports/main amd64 Packages [5157 B]
Get:24 http://cn.archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu xenial-backports/universe amd64 Packages [8088 B]
Reading package lists...
E: GPG error: http://developer.download.nvidia.com/compute/cuda/repos/ubuntu1604/x86_64  Release: The following signatures were invalid: NODATA 1  NODATA 2
E: GPG error: http://developer.download.nvidia.com/compute/machine-learning/repos/ubuntu1604/x86_64  Release: The following signatures were invalid: NODATA 1  NODATA 2

body:
@gunan We were handling this in the docker build process by our own. We may not turn to the non-ssl one and we'd like to wait for next update building from tensorflow. And @yifeif , you will rebuild all the old images(such as 1.7-gpu-py3 etc.) using the updated base image, right？

------  
UPDATE  
@gunan I've just tested building without https, the problem seems still there:  
```shell

  The following signatures were invalid: NODATA 1  NODATA 2
```
